comment.raw:
/**
 * A collection of css custom properties that can be added to {@link ThemeDefinition.vars | theme vars}.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * Defining `base`, then adding mode-specific overrides, is the intended pattern for defining themes, as `dark` and `light` are typically an optional `Partial` of `base`.
 */
comment.summary: A collection of css custom properties that can be added to [ThemeDefinition.vars | theme vars](#ThemeDefinition.vars | theme vars).
comment.remarks: Defining`base`, then adding mode-specific overrides, is the intendedpattern for defining themes, as`dark`and`light`are typically anoptional`Partial`of`base`.

comment.raw:
/**
 * All themes come with a default color definition that can be overridden with partials.
 *
 * All shades have light and dark variants, allowing all other colors to adapt to the mode.
 *
 * The `light` and `dark` variables are automatically generated from the `base` colors if not overridden manually.
 */
comment.summary:
All themes come with a default color definition that can be overridden with partials.

All shades have light and dark variants, allowing all other colors to adapt to the mode.

The light and dark variables are automatically generated from the base colors if not overridden manually.
Arbitrary variables that can be added to a theme.
The minimum required definition for a theme.
A fully resolved theme with all variables applied.
